metadata.description: AMEGA cases perturbed with syntactic transformations

data.case_str: The outpatient clinic is visited by a 58-year-old female with concerns about a persistent lump in her left breast. The lump and dimpling of the surrounding skin were first noticed by her while showering about 8 weeks ago. Over the past month, a subtle retraction of the nipple with redness in the nipple area and blood-tinged discharge, but no pain, as well as a small lump in her left armpit has been observed by her. Birth has never been given by the patient. Her scheduled mammogram was admitted to being skipped by her for the past two years due to anxiety. Upon further history, she reveals that she went through menopause at age 51 and has been on hormone replacement therapy for the past 5 years to manage her post-menopausal symptoms. Any weight loss, fatigue or abdominal or bone pain have not been experienced by her. Her sister was diagnosed with breast cancer at age 31, and a history of uterine cancer was had by her paternal grandmother. Alcohol has never been consumed excessively by her.

transformations: the lump and dimpling of the surrounding skin
a subtle retraction of the nipple with redness in the nipple area and blood - tinged discharge , but no pain , as well as a small lump in her left armpit
any weight loss , fatigue or abdominal or bone pain
original_sentences: A 58-year-old female visits the outpatient clinic with concerns about a persistent lump in her left breast.
She first noticed the lump and dimpling of the surrounding skin while showering about 8 weeks ago.
Over the past month, she has also observed a subtle retraction of the nipple with redness in the nipple area and blood-tinged discharge, but no pain, as well as a small lump in her left armpit.
The patient has never given birth.
She admits to skipping her scheduled mammogram for the past two years due to anxiety.
Upon further history, she reveals that she went through menopause at age 51 and has been on hormone replacement therapy for the past 5 years to manage her post-menopausal symptoms.
She has not experienced any weight loss, fatigue or abdominal or bone pain.
Her sister was diagnosed with breast cancer at age 31, and her paternal grandmother had a history of uterine cancer.
She has never smoked or consumed alcohol excessively.

The lump and dimpling of the surrounding skin were first noticed by her while showering about 8 weeks ago.
Over the past month, a subtle retraction of the nipple with redness in the nipple area and blood-tinged discharge, but no pain, as well as a small lump in her left armpit has been observed by her.
Birth has never been given by the patient.
Her scheduled mammogram was admitted to being skipped by her for the past two years due to anxiety.
Upon further history, she reveals that she went through menopause at age 51 and has been on hormone replacement therapy for the past 5 years to manage her post-menopausal symptoms.
Any weight loss, fatigue or abdominal or bone pain have not been experienced by her.
Her sister was diagnosed with breast cancer at age 31, and a history of uterine cancer was had by her paternal grandmother.
Alcohol has never been consumed excessively by her.

data.case_str: The outpatient clinic is visited by a 65-year-old male, a former smoker, with complaints of persistent cough and shortness of breath for the past two months. Unexplained weight loss and occasional chest pain are also reported by him. Recently, he has started experiencing episodes of coughing up blood. Hypertension and chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) are included by his past medical history.

transformations: a 65 - year - old male , a former smoker ,
unexplained weight loss and occasional chest pain
hypertension and chronic obstructive pulmonary disease ( copd )
original_sentences: A 65-year-old male, a former smoker, visits the outpatient clinic with complaints of persistent cough and shortness of breath for the past two months.
He also reports unexplained weight loss and occasional chest pain.
Recently, he has started experiencing episodes of coughing up blood.
His past medical history includes hypertension and chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD).
transformed_sentences: The outpatient clinic is visited by a 65-year-old male, a former smoker, with complaints of persistent cough and shortness of breath for the past two months.
Unexplained weight loss and occasional chest pain are also reported by him.
Recently, he has started experiencing episodes of coughing up blood.
Hypertension and chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) are included by his past medical history.

data.case_str: A 65-year-old African American male presents to the outpatient clinic with concerns about urinary symptoms that have been worsening over the past six months. A slow urinary stream, increased frequency, nocturia, and occasional difficulty initiating urination are reported by him. In the last two weeks, a mild pain and discomfort in his lower pelvic region has also been noticed by him. The patient mentions he has occasionally seen a hint of blood in his urine but has not experienced any pain while urinating. Upon further questioning, he reveals that he had undergone a vasectomy at age 45 and has a history of benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH) diagnosed three years ago. He has no known history of sexually transmitted infections. A prostate-specific antigen (PSA) test was not admitted to by him for the past four years due to fear of the results. Any significant weight loss, bone pain, or fatigue are denied by him. His father was diagnosed with prostate cancer at age 74, and bladder cancer was had by an uncle. Alcohol is drunk occasionally, but in moderation, by him.

transformations: a slow urinary stream , increased frequency , nocturia , and occasional difficulty initiating urination
a mild pain and discomfort in his lower pelvic region
any significant weight loss , bone pain , or fatigue
original_sentences: A 65-year-old African American male presents to the outpatient clinic with concerns about urinary symptoms that have been worsening over the past six months.
He reports a slow urinary stream, increased frequency, nocturia, and occasional difficulty initiating urination.
In the last two weeks, he has also noticed a mild pain and discomfort in his lower pelvic region.
The patient mentions he has occasionally seen a hint of blood in his urine but has not experienced any pain while urinating.
Upon further questioning, he reveals that he had undergone a vasectomy at age 45 and has a history of benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH) diagnosed three years ago.
He has no known history of sexually transmitted infections.
He admits to not having a prostate-specific antigen (PSA) test for the past four years due to fear of the results.
He denies any significant weight loss, bone pain, or fatigue.
His father was diagnosed with prostate cancer at age 74, and an uncle had bladder cancer.
He has never smoked and drinks alcohol occasionally, but in moderation.

Upon further questioning, he reveals that he had undergone a vasectomy at age 45 and has a history of benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH) diagnosed three years ago.
He has no known history of sexually transmitted infections.
A prostate-specific antigen (PSA) test was not admitted to by him for the past four years due to fear of the results.
Any significant weight loss, bone pain, or fatigue are denied by him.
His father was diagnosed with prostate cancer at age 74, and bladder cancer was had by an uncle.
Alcohol is drunk occasionally, but in moderation, by him.

data.case_str: A 60-year-old male presents to the outpatient clinic with concerns about a change in bowel habits over the past two months, including intermittent blood in the stool and unexplained weight loss. A recent feeling of fatigue and occasional abdominal discomfort, mostly in the lower abdomen, is reported by him. The patient has a history of smoking and a sedentary lifestyle. His family history is significant for colorectal cancer in his father, diagnosed at age 68. Colonoscopy screening has never been undergone by him.

transformations: a recent feeling of fatigue and occasional abdominal discomfort , mostly in the lower abdomen
original_sentences: A 60-year-old male presents to the outpatient clinic with concerns about a change in bowel habits over the past two months, including intermittent blood in the stool and unexplained weight loss.
He also reports a recent feeling of fatigue and occasional abdominal discomfort, mostly in the lower abdomen.
The patient has a history of smoking and a sedentary lifestyle.
His family history is significant for colorectal cancer in his father, diagnosed at age 68.
He has never undergone colonoscopy screening.
transformed_sentences: A 60-year-old male presents to the outpatient clinic with concerns about a change in bowel habits over the past two months, including intermittent blood in the stool and unexplained weight loss.
A recent feeling of fatigue and occasional abdominal discomfort, mostly in the lower abdomen, is reported by him.
The patient has a history of smoking and a sedentary lifestyle.
His family history is significant for colorectal cancer in his father, diagnosed at age 68.
Colonoscopy screening has never been undergone by him.

data.case_str: A 65-year-old male presents to his primary care physican with painless macrohematuria. Upon further questioning, he also complains about fever, night sweats and weight loss in the past few months. He has a history of hypertension, obesity and smoking. Family history is notable for kidney cancer in his grandfather at the age of 72.

original_sentences: A 65-year-old male presents to his primary care physican with painless macrohematuria.
Upon further questioning, he also complains about fever, night sweats and weight loss in the past few months.
He has a history of hypertension, obesity and smoking.
Family history is notable for kidney cancer in his grandfather at the age of 72.

Upon further questioning, he also complains about fever, night sweats and weight loss in the past few months.
He has a history of hypertension, obesity and smoking.
Family history is notable for kidney cancer in his grandfather at the age of 72.

data.case_str: A 35-year-old male presents to his primary care physician for a routine health screening, as part of his new job requirement. Any active complaints are not had by him. However, when inquired about his lifestyle, a diet primarily consisting of fast foods is consumed by him for the past 15 years and he admits to being a regular cigarette smoker. He is also known to have type 2 diabetes mellitus, which he says is "mostly under control" with the help of oral hypoglycemic agents. On further questioning, he reveals that he seldom indulges in physical activities, attributing it to his demanding office job that involves long hours at the desk. He has recently been feeling stressed due to personal issues and increased workload. A history of chronic kidney disease in his family, with his father being on dialysis, is mentioned by him. His body mass index indicates that he is overweight. The patient reports that he recently used his father's automatic monitor to check his blood pressure and found it elevated.

transformations: a diet primarily consisting of fast foods
a history of chronic kidney disease in his family , with his father being on dialysis
original_sentences: A 35-year-old male presents to his primary care physician for a routine health screening, as part of his new job requirement.
He reports feeling generally well and does not have any active complaints.
However, when inquired about his lifestyle, he admits to being a regular cigarette smoker for the past 15 years and consuming a diet primarily consisting of fast foods.
He is also known to have type 2 diabetes mellitus, which he says is "mostly under control" with the help of oral hypoglycemic agents.
On further questioning, he reveals that he seldom indulges in physical activities, attributing it to his demanding office job that involves long hours at the desk.
He has recently been feeling stressed due to personal issues and increased workload.
He also mentions a history of chronic kidney disease in his family, with his father being on dialysis.
His body mass index indicates that he is overweight.
The patient reports that he recently used his father's automatic monitor to check his blood pressure and found it elevated.

Any active complaints are not had by him.
However, when inquired about his lifestyle, a diet primarily consisting of fast foods is consumed by him for the past 15 years and he admits to being a regular cigarette smoker.
He is also known to have type 2 diabetes mellitus, which he says is "mostly under control" with the help of oral hypoglycemic agents.
On further questioning, he reveals that he seldom indulges in physical activities, attributing it to his demanding office job that involves long hours at the desk.
He has recently been feeling stressed due to personal issues and increased workload.
A history of chronic kidney disease in his family, with his father being on dialysis, is mentioned by him.
His body mass index indicates that he is overweight.
The patient reports that he recently used his father's automatic monitor to check his blood pressure and found it elevated.

data.case_str: A 55-year-old male with a history of hypercholesterolemia and smoking is under guideline-directed medical therapy (GDMT) for his chronic stable ischemic heart disease. Despite adherence to his medication regimen, which includes high-intensity statins, beta-blockers, and aspirin, he presents with increasing episodes of chest discomfort and shortness of breath. These symptoms now occur with minimal exertion and occasionally at rest, indicating a potential worsening of his condition. The discomfort is described as a pressure-like sensation in the center of his chest, intensifying during episodes of activity or stress. Dizziness and excessive sweating, particularly noticeable during these episodes of discomfort, are included by accompanying symptoms. His symptoms have progressively worsened over the past few weeks. He has a family history of myocardial infarction, with his father having suffered one at the age of 61. Despite his medication adherence, a specific diet or exercise regime is confessed to not being followed by him.

transformations: dizziness and excessive sweating , particularly noticeable during these episodes of discomfort
a specific diet or exercise regime
original_sentences: A 55-year-old male with a history of hypercholesterolemia and smoking is under guideline-directed medical therapy (GDMT) for his chronic stable ischemic heart disease.
Despite adherence to his medication regimen, which includes high-intensity statins, beta-blockers, and aspirin, he presents with increasing episodes of chest discomfort and shortness of breath.
These symptoms now occur with minimal exertion and occasionally at rest, indicating a potential worsening of his condition.
The discomfort is described as a pressure-like sensation in the center of his chest, intensifying during episodes of activity or stress.
Accompanying symptoms include dizziness and excessive sweating, particularly noticeable during these episodes of discomfort.
His symptoms have progressively worsened over the past few weeks.
He has a family history of myocardial infarction, with his father having suffered one at the age of 61.
Despite his medication adherence, he confesses to not following a specific diet or exercise regime.
transformed_sentences: A 55-year-old male with a history of hypercholesterolemia and smoking is under guideline-directed medical therapy (GDMT) for his chronic stable ischemic heart disease.
Despite adherence to his medication regimen, which includes high-intensity statins, beta-blockers, and aspirin, he presents with increasing episodes of chest discomfort and shortness of breath.
These symptoms now occur with minimal exertion and occasionally at rest, indicating a potential worsening of his condition.
The discomfort is described as a pressure-like sensation in the center of his chest, intensifying during episodes of activity or stress.

His symptoms have progressively worsened over the past few weeks.
He has a family history of myocardial infarction, with his father having suffered one at the age of 61.
Despite his medication adherence, a specific diet or exercise regime is confessed to not being followed by him.

data.case_title: Management of acute chest pain / myocardial infarction
data.case_str: A 62-year-old male presents to the Emergency Department with an acute onset of central chest pain that he describes as "squeezing", which started approximately 2 hours ago while he was gardening. The pain radiates to his left arm and is associated with shortness of breath, sweating, and nausea. He has a history of hypertension and type 2 diabetes mellitus, both well-controlled on medication. His only family history of note is his father, who died of a heart attack at 65 years old.

original_sentences: A 62-year-old male presents to the Emergency Department with an acute onset of central chest pain that he describes as "squeezing", which started approximately 2 hours ago while he was gardening.
The pain radiates to his left arm and is associated with shortness of breath, sweating, and nausea.
He has a history of hypertension and type 2 diabetes mellitus, both well-controlled on medication.
His only family history of note is his father, who died of a heart attack at 65 years old.
transformed_sentences: A 62-year-old male presents to the Emergency Department with an acute onset of central chest pain that he describes as "squeezing", which started approximately 2 hours ago while he was gardening.
The pain radiates to his left arm and is associated with shortness of breath, sweating, and nausea.
He has a history of hypertension and type 2 diabetes mellitus, both well-controlled on medication.
His only family history of note is his father, who died of a heart attack at 65 years old.

data.case_str: A 57-year-old female presents to the Emergency Department with a sudden onset of breathlessness that has been progressing over the past week. Difficulty lying flat is described by her and she finds herself needing to sit up to breathe better. This discomfort also intensifies when she bends forward. Over the past couple of days, swelling in her ankles and a pronounced bulging in the veins of her neck have been noticed by her. Furthermore, a significant reduction in her ability to perform her usual activities is reported by her, attributing it to fatigue and an increased recovery time after any exertion. A peculiar square-wave response has also been noticed by her during her recent doctor's visit when she was asked to perform the Valsalva maneuver. She has a medical history of hypertension and had a heart valve replacement a decade ago. Additionally, chemotherapy for breast cancer was undergone by her five years ago. There is a family history of ischemic heart disease: a myocardial infarction was suffered by her mother in her 60s.

transformations: swelling in her ankles and a pronounced bulging in the veins of her neck
a significant reduction in her ability to perform her usual activities
original_sentences: A 57-year-old female presents to the Emergency Department with a sudden onset of breathlessness that has been progressing over the past week.
She describes difficulty lying flat and finds herself needing to sit up to breathe better.
This discomfort also intensifies when she bends forward.
Over the past couple of days, she has noticed swelling in her ankles and a pronounced bulging in the veins of her neck.
Furthermore, she reports a significant reduction in her ability to perform her usual activities, attributing it to fatigue and an increased recovery time after any exertion.
She mentions waking up in the middle of the night coughing and has also noticed a peculiar square-wave response during her recent doctor's visit when she was asked to perform the Valsalva maneuver.
She has a medical history of hypertension and had a heart valve replacement a decade ago.
Additionally, she underwent chemotherapy for breast cancer five years ago.
There is a family history of ischemic heart disease: her mother suffered a myocardial infarction in her 60s.
transformed_sentences: A 57-year-old female presents to the Emergency Department with a sudden onset of breathlessness that has been progressing over the past week.
Difficulty lying flat is described by her and she finds herself needing to sit up to breathe better.
This discomfort also intensifies when she bends forward.
Over the past couple of days, swelling in her ankles and a pronounced bulging in the veins of her neck have been noticed by her.
Furthermore, a significant reduction in her ability to perform her usual activities is reported by her, attributing it to fatigue and an increased recovery time after any exertion.
A peculiar square-wave response has also been noticed by her during her recent doctor's visit when she was asked to perform the Valsalva maneuver.
She has a medical history of hypertension and had a heart valve replacement a decade ago.
Additionally, chemotherapy for breast cancer was undergone by her five years ago.
There is a family history of ischemic heart disease: a myocardial infarction was suffered by her mother in her 60s.

data.case_str: A 59-year-old female presents to the radiology department for the first follow-up CT scan after resection of the right upper lobe due to small cell lung cancer. She has been administered iv contrast agent one time before during a preoperative staging CT scan. A few minutes after iv contrast injection, rapidly progressive severe cough, vomiting and wheezing are experienced by the patient. She is very agitated and reports that she cannot breathe. There is a rash on her upper chest, neck and face that was not present before the CT scan. The patient has a history of asthma and atopic dermatitis.

transformations: rapidly progressive severe cough , vomiting and wheezing
original_sentences: A 59-year-old female presents to the radiology department for the first follow-up CT scan after resection of the right upper lobe due to small cell lung cancer.
She has been administered iv contrast agent one time before during a preoperative staging CT scan.
A few minutes after iv contrast injection, the patient experiences rapidly progressive severe cough, vomiting and wheezing.
She is very agitated and reports that she cannot breathe.
There is a rash on her upper chest, neck and face that was not present before the CT scan.
The patient has a history of asthma and atopic dermatitis.

She has been administered iv contrast agent one time before during a preoperative staging CT scan.
A few minutes after iv contrast injection, rapidly progressive severe cough, vomiting and wheezing are experienced by the patient.
She is very agitated and reports that she cannot breathe.
There is a rash on her upper chest, neck and face that was not present before the CT scan.
The patient has a history of asthma and atopic dermatitis.

data.case_str: A 45-year-old female with a history of well-controlled asthma and allergic rhinitis presents with increasing episodes of wheezing, shortness of breath, and chest tightness. These symptoms now occur with minimal exertion and occasionally at rest, indicating a potential exacerbation of her asthma. The wheezing is described as a high-pitched whistling sound, especially noticeable at night and early in the morning. A dry cough and feeling of tightness in the chest are included by accompanying symptoms. Her symptoms have progressively worsened over the past few days. She has a family history of asthma, with her mother having suffered from severe asthma. She has been adherent to her inhaler regimen, which includes low-dose inhaled corticosteroids and a long-acting beta-agonist but confesses to encountering recent stress and exposure to pollen.

transformations: a dry cough and feeling of tightness in the chest
original_sentences: A 45-year-old female with a history of well-controlled asthma and allergic rhinitis presents with increasing episodes of wheezing, shortness of breath, and chest tightness.
These symptoms now occur with minimal exertion and occasionally at rest, indicating a potential exacerbation of her asthma.
The wheezing is described as a high-pitched whistling sound, especially noticeable at night and early in the morning.
Accompanying symptoms include a dry cough and feeling of tightness in the chest.
Her symptoms have progressively worsened over the past few days.
She has a family history of asthma, with her mother having suffered from severe asthma.
She has been adherent to her inhaler regimen, which includes low-dose inhaled corticosteroids and a long-acting beta-agonist but confesses to encountering recent stress and exposure to pollen.

She has been adherent to her inhaler regimen, which includes low-dose inhaled corticosteroids and a long-acting beta-agonist but confesses to encountering recent stress and exposure to pollen.

data.case_title: Management of chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD)
data.case_str: A 68-year-old female presents to the clinic with a persistent cough and increasing difficulty in breathing over the past few months. A long history of smoking, approximately a pack a day for 40 years, though she quit smoking 5 years ago, is reported by her. Frequent bouts of bronchitis every winter for the last few years are also mentioned by her. On examination, wheezing during expiration and a prolonged expiratory phase are exhibited by her. Her respiratory rate is elevated, and she appears to be using accessory muscles to breathe.

transformations: a long history of smoking , approximately a pack a day for 40 years , though she quit smoking 5 years ago
frequent bouts of bronchitis every winter for the last few years
wheezing during expiration and a prolonged expiratory phase
original_sentences: A 68-year-old female presents to the clinic with a persistent cough and increasing difficulty in breathing over the past few months.
She reports a long history of smoking, approximately a pack a day for 40 years, though she quit smoking 5 years ago.
She also mentions frequent bouts of bronchitis every winter for the last few years.
On examination, she exhibits wheezing during expiration and a prolonged expiratory phase.
Her respiratory rate is elevated, and she appears to be using accessory muscles to breathe.
transformed_sentences: A 68-year-old female presents to the clinic with a persistent cough and increasing difficulty in breathing over the past few months.
A long history of smoking, approximately a pack a day for 40 years, though she quit smoking 5 years ago, is reported by her.
Frequent bouts of bronchitis every winter for the last few years are also mentioned by her.
On examination, wheezing during expiration and a prolonged expiratory phase are exhibited by her.
Her respiratory rate is elevated, and she appears to be using accessory muscles to breathe.

data.case_str: A 52-year-old male with a notable history of alcohol use disorder and a recent diagnosis of nonalcoholic steatohepatitis (NASH) presents with multiple symptoms indicative of advanced liver disease. Persistent fatigue and significant weight loss over the past few months are reported by him. On examination, abdominal distension, suggestive of ascites, a common complication of cirrhosis, is exhibited by him. Additionally, jaundice, a clear sign of hepatic dysfunction, has been developed by him. Spider angiomas on his chest and arms, as well as palmar erythema, are included by dermatological findings. He has a long history of alcohol consumption, averaging over two decades, and admits to using over-the-counter pain relievers regularly for chronic back pain. No family history of liver disease is had by him and he leads a sedentary lifestyle.

transformations: persistent fatigue and significant weight loss over the past few months
abdominal distension , suggestive of ascites , a common complication of cirrhosis
jaundice , a clear sign of hepatic dysfunction
spider angiomas on his chest and arms , as well as palmar erythema
no family history of liver disease
original_sentences: A 52-year-old male with a notable history of alcohol use disorder and a recent diagnosis of nonalcoholic steatohepatitis (NASH) presents with multiple symptoms indicative of advanced liver disease.
He reports persistent fatigue and significant weight loss over the past few months.
On examination, he exhibits abdominal distension, suggestive of ascites, a common complication of cirrhosis.
Additionally, he has developed jaundice, a clear sign of hepatic dysfunction.
Dermatological findings include spider angiomas on his chest and arms, as well as palmar erythema.
He has a long history of alcohol consumption, averaging over two decades, and admits to using over-the-counter pain relievers regularly for chronic back pain.
He leads a sedentary lifestyle and has no family history of liver disease.
transformed_sentences: A 52-year-old male with a notable history of alcohol use disorder and a recent diagnosis of nonalcoholic steatohepatitis (NASH) presents with multiple symptoms indicative of advanced liver disease.
Persistent fatigue and significant weight loss over the past few months are reported by him.
On examination, abdominal distension, suggestive of ascites, a common complication of cirrhosis, is exhibited by him.
Additionally, jaundice, a clear sign of hepatic dysfunction, has been developed by him.
Spider angiomas on his chest and arms, as well as palmar erythema, are included by dermatological findings.
He has a long history of alcohol consumption, averaging over two decades, and admits to using over-the-counter pain relievers regularly for chronic back pain.
No family history of liver disease is had by him and he leads a sedentary lifestyle.

data.case_str: A 68-year-old female presents to the Emergency Department with reduced urine output and fatigue over the past two days. Orthostatic dizziness and palpitations have been experienced by her, especially when standing up quickly. A recent severe bout of diarrhea, after which she did not adequately rehydrate herself, was mentioned by her. She has a medical history of hypertension and type 2 diabetes mellitus, managed with medication. Recently, she started taking NSAIDs for joint pain. She also complains of mild shortness of breath and peripheral edema.

transformations: a recent severe bout of diarrhea , after which she did not adequately rehydrate herself
original_sentences: A 68-year-old female presents to the Emergency Department with reduced urine output and fatigue over the past two days.
She has been experiencing orthostatic dizziness and palpitations, especially when standing up quickly.
She mentions a recent severe bout of diarrhea, after which she did not adequately rehydrate herself.
She has a medical history of hypertension and type 2 diabetes mellitus, managed with medication.
Recently, she started taking NSAIDs for joint pain.
She also complains of mild shortness of breath and peripheral edema.

She has a medical history of hypertension and type 2 diabetes mellitus, managed with medication.
Recently, she started taking NSAIDs for joint pain.
She also complains of mild shortness of breath and peripheral edema.

data.case_str: A 55-year-old male with a history of hypercholesterolemia and smoking presents with concerns related to his chronic kidney disease (CKD). He has been diagnosed with CKD stage 3 due to longstanding hypertension and type 2 diabetes mellitus, which are well-controlled with medication. Recently, increased fatigue, occasional nocturia, and pruritus have been experienced by him. A gradual increase in serum creatinine levels over the past few months is reported by him. He has a family history of CKD, with his mother having been diagnosed in her late 60s. He admits to a diet high in processed foods and has not been adhering to recommended fluid intake.

transformations: increased fatigue , occasional nocturia , and pruritus
a gradual increase in serum creatinine levels over the past few months
original_sentences: A 55-year-old male with a history of hypercholesterolemia and smoking presents with concerns related to his chronic kidney disease (CKD).
He has been diagnosed with CKD stage 3 due to longstanding hypertension and type 2 diabetes mellitus, which are well-controlled with medication.
Recently, he has been experiencing increased fatigue, occasional nocturia, and pruritus.
He reports a gradual increase in serum creatinine levels over the past few months.
He has a family history of CKD, with his mother having been diagnosed in her late 60s.
He admits to a diet high in processed foods and has not been adhering to recommended fluid intake.
transformed_sentences: A 55-year-old male with a history of hypercholesterolemia and smoking presents with concerns related to his chronic kidney disease (CKD).
He has been diagnosed with CKD stage 3 due to longstanding hypertension and type 2 diabetes mellitus, which are well-controlled with medication.
Recently, increased fatigue, occasional nocturia, and pruritus have been experienced by him.
A gradual increase in serum creatinine levels over the past few months is reported by him.
He has a family history of CKD, with his mother having been diagnosed in her late 60s.
He admits to a diet high in processed foods and has not been adhering to recommended fluid intake.

data.case_str: A 62-year-old male presents to the primary care clinic for a routine follow-up. Increased thirst, frequent urination, and a recent unexplained weight loss of 10 pounds over the past two months are reported by him. He has a history of hypertension and a sedentary lifestyle. His family history is significant for type 2 diabetes mellitus in his mother, and there's a known history of cardiovascular disease in the family. He is overweight, with a recent increase in weight prior to the unexplained weight loss. Lisinopril for hypertension is included by his current medications. He has no known allergies.

transformations: increased thirst , frequent urination , and a recent unexplained weight loss of 10 pounds over the past two months
original_sentences: A 62-year-old male presents to the primary care clinic for a routine follow-up.
He reports increased thirst, frequent urination, and a recent unexplained weight loss of 10 pounds over the past two months.
He has a history of hypertension and a sedentary lifestyle.
His family history is significant for type 2 diabetes mellitus in his mother, and there's a known history of cardiovascular disease in the family.
He is overweight, with a recent increase in weight prior to the unexplained weight loss.
His current medications include lisinopril for hypertension.
He has no known allergies.
transformed_sentences: A 62-year-old male presents to the primary care clinic for a routine follow-up.
Increased thirst, frequent urination, and a recent unexplained weight loss of 10 pounds over the past two months are reported by him.
He has a history of hypertension and a sedentary lifestyle.
His family history is significant for type 2 diabetes mellitus in his mother, and there's a known history of cardiovascular disease in the family.
He is overweight, with a recent increase in weight prior to the unexplained weight loss.
Lisinopril for hypertension is included by his current medications.
He has no known allergies.

data.case_str: A 30-year-old male presents to the Emergency Department complaining of abdominal pain that began around 10 hours ago. The pain initially started around his navel but has since migrated to the right lower quadrant (RLQ) of his abdomen. The pain is described as a constant, dull ache that intensifies with movement by him. Loss of appetite, nausea, and a low-grade fever are included by accompanying symptoms. Any vomiting, diarrhea, or urinary symptoms are denied by him. The patient has no significant past medical or surgical history. He is not on any medications and has no known drug allergies. There is no family history of gastrointestinal diseases. On examination, his vital signs are stable, but he exhibits tenderness in the RLQ on palpation.

any vomiting , diarrhea , or urinary symptoms

He denies any vomiting, diarrhea, or urinary symptoms.
The patient has no significant past medical or surgical history.
He is not on any medications and has no known drug allergies.
There is no family history of gastrointestinal diseases.
On examination, his vital signs are stable, but he exhibits tenderness in the RLQ on palpation.

data.case_str: A 72-year-old male presents to the Emergency Department with sudden onset of right-sided weakness and difficulty speaking. The symptoms were first noticed upon waking up, approximately 3 hours before presenting to the hospital. The patient has a medical history of well-controlled hypertension and type 2 diabetes mellitus. There is a significant family history of cerebrovascular disease, with a stroke having been experienced by his father at the age of 65.

data.case_str: A 32-year-old individual presents to the clinic with symptoms persisting for three weeks. Fever, fatigue, generalized rash, unintentional weight loss, and occasional night sweats are included by the clinical manifestations. A history of multiple unprotected sexual encounters and intravenous drug use is also reported by the patient. There is no significant medical or family history reported. Additionally, swollen lymph nodes have been noticed by the patient. Episodes of nausea and diarrhea within the same time frame are also described by them. Despite the absence of any chronic conditions, concern about the sudden onset and persistence of these symptoms is expressed by the patient.

concern about the sudden onset and persistence of these symptoms

There is no significant medical or family history reported.
Additionally, the patient mentions experiencing frequent headaches, muscle and joint pains, and has noticed swollen lymph nodes.
They also describe episodes of nausea and diarrhea within the same time frame.
Despite the absence of any chronic conditions, the patient expresses concern about the sudden onset and persistence of these symptoms.

data.case_str: A 35-year-old male presents to his primary care physician for a mandatory health screening required by his new employer. A history of regular cigarette smoking for the past 15 years and a diet predominantly consisting of fast food are reported by the patient. He has a known history of type 2 diabetes, which he manages with oral hypoglycemics. Due to his sedentary job, he admits to a lack of regular physical activity. The patient expresses experiencing increased levels of stress recently, stemming from both personal issues and heightened demands at work. A family history of chronic kidney disease and his concern about being overweight, as indicated by his body mass index, are mentioned by him. During the consultation, feelings of persistent sadness and a noticeable loss of interest in activities that he once found enjoyable are revealed by the patient. They were initially attributed to the stress in his life by him but are now recognized as overwhelming and persistent. In addition to the primary concerns, occasional disturbances in his sleep pattern, fluctuating appetite, and a sense of fatigue that seems disproportionate to his level of physical activity are also noted by the patient. He mentions struggling with concentration at work and feeling unusually indecisive, even in mundane day-to-day decisions.

transformations: a history of regular cigarette smoking for the past 15 years and a diet predominantly consisting of fast food
a family history of chronic kidney disease and his concern about being overweight , as indicated by his body mass index
feelings of persistent sadness and a noticeable loss of interest in activities he once found that enjoyable
occasional disturbances in his sleep pattern , fluctuating appetite , and a sense of fatigue that seems disproportionate to his level of physical activity

The patient appears overall healthy but reports a history of regular cigarette smoking for the past 15 years and a diet predominantly consisting of fast food.
He has a known history of type 2 diabetes, which he manages with oral hypoglycemics.
Due to his sedentary job, he admits to a lack of regular physical activity.
The patient expresses experiencing increased levels of stress recently, stemming from both personal issues and heightened demands at work.
He mentions a family history of chronic kidney disease and his concern about being overweight, as indicated by his body mass index.
During the consultation, the patient reveals feelings of persistent sadness and a noticeable loss of interest in activities that he once found enjoyable.
He initially attributed these feelings to the stress in his life but now recognizes them as overwhelming and persistent.

In addition to the primary concerns, the patient also notes occasional disturbances in his sleep pattern, fluctuating appetite, and a sense of fatigue that seems disproportionate to his level of physical activity.
He mentions struggling with concentration at work and feeling unusually indecisive, even in mundane day-to-day decisions.
